properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, hail up to 2 centimetres and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times are expected or occurring in the area. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant Rainfall for Northeastern BC This Weekend. A series of disturbances will move through northern BC bringing periods of moderate to heavy rainfall tonight through Monday. Potential impacts for this event include rising rivers and destabilizing slopes. An already moist air mass will be enhanced by upslope flow, particularly on the east slopes of the Northern Rockies. The communities of Liard River, Muncho Lake, Toad River, Nelson Forks, Sikanni Chief and their surrounding higher terrain may see up to 50 to 80 mm of total rainfall. These areas have experienced moderate rainfall events over the past few weeks thus the ground is quite saturated in some places. Stay tuned to your local weather forecast and alerts: www.weather.gc.ca Flood Warnings and Advisories can be viewed at: http://bcrfc.env.gov.bc.ca/warnings/index.htm Road Conditions: https://drivebc.ca/ ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T09:34:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T17:35:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2843023079.2020
Area: Muncho Lake Park - Stone Mountain Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, hail up to 2 centimetres and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times are expected or occurring in the area. Strong thunderstorms are moving off the coast and pushing east into the eastern parts of the Chaleur-Miscou region and may give local gusts to 40 knots and large hail. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Isolated thunderstorms are detected over the region and may intensify during the evening. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T04:59:06-00:00

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times are expected or occurring in the area. Thunderstorms are advancing eastward into the west end of Lake Ontario. ### Poor to very poor visibility may contribute to voyage delays and make marine navigation hazardous. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:17 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. This severe thunderstorm is located 5 kilometres east of Mariposa, moving east at 30 km/h. Locations impacted include: Lindsay, Valentia and Reaboro. ### Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-06T00:13:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T21:18:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3057144460.2020
Area: Lindsay - Southern Kawartha Lakes
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing heavy rain. Thunderstorms will form this evening and could last until Saturday morning. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T11:50:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T19:51:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4116918774.2020

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A nearly stationary east to west line of showers and thunderstorms is affecting areas north of Timmins and Kapuskasing. Local rainfall amounts of up to 75 mm will be possible by later this evening. Locations impacted include: Fraserdale, Little Abitibi Provincial Park, Relay, Abitibi Canyon, Brownrigg and Island Falls. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T06:39:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T21:44:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1053968964.2020
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:17 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. A thunderstorm near Keswick Ridge is moving eastward at about 50 km/h and will pass near the Fredericton area in the next 30 minutes. Wind gusts of 90 km/h or stronger and hail of 2 cm or larger are possible. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-06T00:16:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T21:18:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3186718340.2020
Area: Fredericton and Southern York County, Oromocto and Sunbury County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Slowing moving thunderstorms giving heavy rain this afternoon. A southwest to northeast line of slow moving thunderstorms is affecting portions of the Greater Toronto Area this afternoon. Local rainfall amounts of up to 50 mm are possible by 5PM. Locations impacted include: Mississauga, Downtown Toronto and Etobicoke. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T00:53:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-05T19:04:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3005767291.2020
Area: City of Toronto, Mississauga - Brampton

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. A cluster of thunderstorms moving across the region are giving strong wind gusts and hail. These conditions will persist this evening and possibly reach warning criteria. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
